etymology.interpretation: Combines a meat-related component with the phonetic 爻 to signal a word about prepared meat dishes. Over time the shape came to look like 乂 above 有 as part of 爻 shifted to the side.
etymology.simplification: Simplified from 餚 by dropping the food radical 飠 and using the older graph 肴, reducing strokes while preserving meaning and phonetic support.

examples.chinese: 今天的菜肴很丰盛(今天的菜餚很豐盛)。
这些佳肴都是他亲手做的(這些佳餚都是他親手做的)。
examples.pinyin: Zhèxiē jiāyáo dōu shì tā qīnshǒu zuò de.
examples.english: These delicacies were all made by him personally.

examples.chinese: 过年时，家家户户都备上几道拿手菜肴(過年時，家家戶戶都備上幾道拿手菜餚)。
examples.pinyin: Guònián shí, jiājiā hùhù dōu bèi shàng jǐ dào náshǒu càiyáo.
examples.english: At New Year, every household prepares a few signature dishes.
